intro: Didactyle ochracea, commonly known as the yellow sandmat, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the family Amaranthaceae and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy stems and leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically yellow or orange in color. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Didactyle ochracea is often used in xeriscaping due to its low water requirements and ornamental appearance.
